newsArray: Prime Minister Narendra Modi describes his Austria visit as historic and immensely productive; Says it has added vigour to ties between the two countries.
Second BIMSTEC Foreign Ministers' Retreat to begin today in New Delhi.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi to interact with economists in New Delhi to elicit their views on upcoming Union Budget.
Health Ministry says, existing district and referral hospitals which have been converted into Medical Colleges will continue to receive funding from Central government.
IMD forecasts heavy rain in Goa, Maharashtra, Gujarat and Coastal Karnataka till Sunday.
In Tennis, N. Sriram Balaji and his partner Gonzalo Escobar advance to quarter-finals of Men's Doubles event at Brawo Open Challenger in Germany.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi describes his Austria visit as historic and immensely productive; Says it has added vigour to ties between the two countries.
Second BIMSTEC Foreign Ministers' Retreat to begin today in New Delhi.

word.meaning: A simple program that outputs 'Hello, World!' to the screen. It is often used to illustrate the basic syntax of a programming language for a working program.
word.example: The first program that students write in any new programming language is 'Hello, World!'

quote.quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
quote.author: Steve Jobs

history.event: Rajarshi Shahu Chhatrapati, great revolutionary freedom fighter and social reformer, was born.
Narayan Shripad Rajhans (Balgandharv), famous singer and actor, was born.
Ghanshyam Das Birla, great freedom fighter and social reformer, was born at Pilani.
M.P. Sivagnanam, famous Tamil writer and social worker, was born at Madras.
Nehru, Chou En-lai pledge good-neighbor policy at New Delhi.
Chaudhary Charan Singh, freedom fighter and Chief Minister of UP, arrested by Government.
First Boeing 707 of Air India `Gaurishankar' was crashed at Sahar Airport (Bombay).
Five hundred killed or missing as monsoon floods hit the Indian state of Gujarat.
Sharad Pawar joins Union Cabinet as Defence Minister.
The Tin Bigha corridor leased to Bangladesh as per the Indo-Bangladesh agreement.
Madhya Pradesh declared 'Tiger State' as it homes one sixth of the world's tiger population.
India declares its chemical weapon stockpiles and storage facilities as part of its obligations as signatory to the Chemical Weapons Convention.
